Job Title: Scientist, Opto-Mechanical Engineer

Job Code: 24130

Job Location:  Wilmington, MA

Job Schedule: Full time, 9/80 (Every other Friday off!)

Relocation: Relocation assistance is available to qualified applicants

 

Job Description:  

L3Harris is seeking a highly skilled and dynamic senior Mechanical Engineer to
perform design, development and analysis tasks which may include complex
precision mechanical components and/or support equipment in a program team
environment. The Scientist, Mechanical Engineer will provide program support and
technical leadership over requirements definition, concept generation, material
selection, trade studies, design sensitivity/optimization studies, preliminary
and final design, design documentation, manufacturing, and assembly/integration
and testing. Candidate must have strong proficiency in 3D modeling, design for
manufacturing, mechanical analysis and ability to work independently or within a
multi-disciplined team environment.

 

Role entails responsibility for improving upon existing processes or
establishing new systems using significant conceptualizing, reasoning and
interpretation, developing and championing new concepts or technologies, complex
problem solving and innovation requiring broad-based consideration of variables
that impact multiple functions and/or businesses, extensively analyzing problems
to seek understanding of the root cause of the problem & recommending tactics
and strategies that directly impact the achievement of overall business or
functional results, and communicating within and outside of the organization to
influence leadership to accept new practices, approaches, and concepts.

 

Essential Functions: 

 * Responsible for establishing key performance error budgets.
 * Designs strain-free mounted mirror assemblies.
 * Creates and releases mirror component and mounted mirror drawings.
 * Leverages high reliability, flight-proven, heritage design concepts in order
   to produce high quality novel designs within an aggressive timeline.
 * Generates test plans and define requirements for support equipment.
 * Defines and establishes the technical approach to meet assigned objective.
 * Directs, coordinates and provides assistance to engineering team in order to
   meet assigned objectives.
 * Prepares reports, formal documentation and presentation materials summarizing
   analysis results and present results to both external and internal groups,
   including leadership and customers.
 * Participates in and present information for Preliminary Design reviews (PDR),
   Critical Design Reviews (CDR) and Technical Interchange Meetings (TIM).
 * Interfaces with outside suppliers/customers and other engineering disciplines
   to drive designs to closure (Structural, Thermal, Electrical, Manufacturing,
   Performance, Quality, Configuration Management).
 * Presents design details at program reviews to customers and independent
   reviewers.
 * Develops and performs testing to show proof-of-concept and/or qualification
   of new designs
 * Supports production operations with design of tooling, test equipment, and
   assembly aids, strong DfMA skills as required.
 * Provides regular status updates to Program Management and Project Engineers
   on technical, cost and schedule performance.
 * Works under consultative direction against annual goals and objectives
 * Establish educational and training goals for area of expertise and ensuring
   those goals are achieved

 

Qualifications:  

 * Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering or related
   disciplines from an ABET Accredited program and a minimum of 12 years of
   prior relevant experience. Graduate Degree in Mechanical Engineering,
   Aerospace Engineering, Engineering Mechanics, or related disciplines from an
   ABET Accredited program and a minimum of 10 years of prior related
   experience. In lieu of a degree, minimum of 16 years of prior related
   experience.
 * 6+ years in CAD modeling and design tools
 * Prior or current experience with optomechanical engineering
 * Experience leading a multi-disciplinary mechanical engineering team through
   system requirements, design, analysis, test, hardware build, delivery and
   launch
 * Professional experience using and/or directing finite element analysis (FEA)
   is required
 * Professional experience with analysis methods (FEA and hand-calculations) is
   required
 * Professional experience working with and leading multi-disciplinary
   mechanical engineering team through system requirements, design, analysis,
   test, hardware build, delivery and launch
 * Must be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Security Clearance

 

Preferred Additional Skills:

 * Top Secret SCI/DoD clearance preferred
 * Proficiency in design and 3D modeling of solids, surfaces, and assemblies
   (primary CAD tool will be CREO)
 * Strong proficiency in design of 2D engineering drawings using geometrical
   dimensioning & tolerancing (GD&T) per ASME Y14.5 standards
 * Proficiency in analysis FEA tools such as FEMAP, MSC Nastran, ANSYS, Sigfit
 * Proficiency in tolerance stack-up analysis for mechanical designs
 * Experience in leading engineering teams from conceptual through detailed
   design phases
 * Experience building hardware in a high reliability environment
 * Capable of serving as a design lead and/or integrated product team lead
   (IPTL), leading and supporting program design reviews (PDR, CDR)
 * Proficiency working with a product data manager (PDM) software, and
   familiarity with configuration management best practices
 * Training and mentoring of new hires and junior engineering staff members.
 * Understanding of the different materials used in the design of optical
   assemblies and how to trade material choices

In compliance with pay transparency requirements, the salary range for this role
in California, Massachusetts, New Jersey, Washington, and the Greater D.C,
Denver, or NYC areas is $143,000.00 - $266,000.00. The salary range for this
role in Colorado state, Hawaii, Illinois, Maryland, Minnesota, New York state,
and Vermont is $124,000.00 - $231,000.00. This is not a guarantee of
compensation or salary, as final offer amount may vary based on factors
including but not limited to experience and geographic location. L3Harris also
offers a variety of benefits, including health and disability insurance, 401(k)
match, flexible spending accounts, EAP, education assistance, parental leave,
paid time off, and company-paid holidays. The specific programs and options

We are seeking a dedicated Optical Engineer to join our team, providing critical
on-site support for our aerospace programs. This role involves hands-on lab
work, precise optical alignment, and meticulous inspection processes. Our
projects span imaging systems across the UV to LWIR regions of the
electromagnetic spectrum. The successful candidate will be deeply involved in
the practical aspects of optical engineering, ensuring the integrity and
performance of our sophisticated optical systems.
 

Essential Functions:

 * Conduct thorough testing and alignment of complex optical systems within a
   lab environment.
 * Collaborate with cross-disciplinary teams to achieve project objectives,
   demonstrating strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work well in a
   team setting.
 * Utilize strong organizational skills to manage tasks and documentation
   effectively.
 * Apply written and verbal communication skills to document processes, convey
   technical information, and facilitate effective teamwork.
 * Engage in troubleshooting activities and verification of system requirements
   to ensure compliance and functionality.
 * Support optical design and modeling efforts as needed, with a focus on
   hands-on application and testing.
 * Perform detailed inspection of optical components to maintain system
   integrity.
 * Participate in systems trade studies, vender assessments with an emphasis on
   practical evaluation and lab-based experimentation.
 * Mentor and guide new engineers in the art of optical alignments and
   techniques, ensuring knowledge transfer and adherence to best practices for
   lab-based system builds and experimental setups.

Qualifications:

 * Bachelor’s Degree and minimum 4 years of prior relevant experience. Graduate
   Degree and a minimum of 2 years of prior related experience. In lieu of a
   degree, minimum of 8 years of prior related experience.
 * Ability to acquire a DoD Secret clearance.

Preferred Additional Skills:

 * Experience with Zemax and/or Code V optical software for design and analysis
   purposes.
 * Experience with MATLAB for data analysis and automation of testing
   procedures.
 * Experience with hands-on lab work, optical alignment, and inspection
   processes.

hits.title: Accounting Assistant at Hyatt Anchorage, AK
hits.description:
Accounting Assistant job at Hyatt. Anchorage, AK. Position Overview:



At The Wildbirch Hotel, our Accounting Assistant provides administrative and
clerical support to accountants and the accounting- and payroll department,
handling tasks like bookkeeping, data entry, invoice processing, payroll
processing and financial record-keeping, ensuring accuracy and efficiency in
financial operations.



A valid work authorization for the USA is required - Please note that we do not
provide any visa sponsoring for the listed role.



Here's a more detailed breakdown of an Accounting Assistant's typical duties and
responsibilities:



 * Bookkeeping and Data Entry:
    * Maintaining financial records, including general ledger and sales ledger.
    * Entering financial transactions into accounting software.
    * Processing invoices and payments.

 * Financial Record-Keeping:
    * Ensuring accuracy and completeness of financial data.
    * Maintaining and organizing financial documents.
    * Reconciling bank statements and account balances.
    * Preparing financial reports and statements.

 * Administrative Support:
    * Assisting with accounts payable and accounts receivable.
    * Handling payroll processing.
    * Preparing bank deposits.
    * Filing and organizing financial documents.
    * Answering phone calls and responding to emails.

 * Other Responsibilities:
    * Assisting with audits.
    * Preparing purchase orders.
    * Tracking expenses.
    * Supporting the accounting department with various tasks.
      

Why Work at The Wildbirch Hotel?



As Anchorage’s first boutique hotel, The Wildbirch Hotel offers a dynamic,
local-first environment where team members are encouraged to share their passion
for Alaska. Be part of the first team welcoming guests to the hotel and helping
to shape the guest experience in a setting that celebrates the adventure, charm,
and rugged beauty of the state.



This position is at a location where Hyatt is not the employer. The employer of
individuals working at this hotel may be a third-party management company that
is responsible for all employment benefits and obligations at this location.
